sepono: <entryFree id="n43713" type="main" key="se_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n43713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf. sync.</hi> sepostus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 378</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:281" default="NO">17, 281</bibl>; but, sepositus,<cb n="SEPT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 84</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lay apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aside; to put by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, etc. (class.; not in Cæs.; syn.: sejungo, segrego, recondo). </sense><sense id="n43713.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43713.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">seponi et occultari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid habere sepositum et reconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>; so (with conditus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 54, 112</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta seposita (for which, just before, recondita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego ad illud fanum (sc. ornandum) sepositum putabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivam pecuniam in aedificationem templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitias magno Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:730" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullos ex principibus legit ac seposuit ad pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et pecuniam et frumentum in decem annos seposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors aliquem seponit ac servat, qui cum victore contendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interesse pugnae imperatorem an seponi melius foret, dubitavere,</quote> <trans><tr>to place himself at a distance</tr>, <tr>withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mille sagittis Unam seposuit,</quote> <trans><tr>picked out</tr>, <tr>selected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 381</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to send into banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">relego): aliquem a domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in provinciam specie legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in secretum Asiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 88; 2, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set aside</hi> mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod primum se obtulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi>, for any purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alius aliam sibi partem, in quā elaboraret, seponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ad eam rem tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temporis hortorum aut villarum curae seponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam senectuti seposui,</quote> <trans><tr>have set apart</tr>, <tr>reserved for my old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seposuit Aegyptum,</quote> <trans><tr>he sequestered Egypt</tr>, <tr>made it forbidden ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepositus servilibus poenis locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re sepositus est nobis locus,</quote> <trans><tr>made it a special division of the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi> from others, <hi rend="ital">exclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, etc.: Jovem diffusum nectare curas Seposuisse graves, <hi rend="ital">had laid aside</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had discarded for a while</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 319</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Graecos) seposuisse a ceteris dictionibus eam partem dicendi, quae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to have separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio suadendi ab honesti quaestione seposita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with simple <case>abl.</case>: si modo Scimus inurbanum lepido seponere dicto, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">distinguish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 273</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare). </sense><sense id="n43713.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, = remotus: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 339" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 339</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea seposita est et ab omni milite dissors Gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>sumptuous garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seposito de grege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepositio: <entryFree id="n43714" type="main" key="se_po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sepono</etym>, <sense id="n43714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoarding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43714.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A separation</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si forte qui decimam vovit decesserit ante sepositionem (for which, just before, separata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:2:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepositus: <entryFree id="n43715" type="main" key="se_po^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sepono.</entryFree>
seps: <entryFree id="n43716" type="greek" key="seps1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seps</orth>, <itype>sēpis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sh/y</foreign>. <sense id="n43716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A venomous serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose bite occasioned putrefaction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:764 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 764 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:723" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 723</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. sing.</hi> sepa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 102</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. Plur.</hi> sepas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 29, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Grammat. 12, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43716.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An insect</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the wood-louse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milleped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:137" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43717" type="main" key="seps2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seps</orth>, v. 1. saepes.</entryFree>
sepse: <entryFree id="n43718" type="hapax" key="sepse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sepse</orth>, <sense id="n43718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. reflex. fem.</hi> [se - ipse], <hi rend="ital">one's self.</hi> quae (virtus) omnes magis quam sepse diligit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl> (also cited by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
septa: <entryFree id="n43719" type="main" key="septa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. saepio <sense id="n43719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
septages:
<entryFree id="n43720" type="main" key="septages"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septages</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">yi/ttakos</foreign>, <sense id="n43720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 58, § 117</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">septăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e(pta/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the number seven</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
septejugis: <entryFree id="n43721" type="gloss" key="septe^ju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĕjŭgis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. currus) [septem-jugum; cf. <sense id="n43721.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">1. sejugis],</quote> <trans><tr>a team of seven</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 337, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septem: <entryFree id="n43722" type="main" key="septem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem</orth>, <sense id="n43722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. indecl.</hi> [Sanscr. saptan; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/</foreign>; Goth. sibun; Germ. sieben; Engl. seven], <hi rend="ital">seven</hi>: septem menses sunt, <cb n="SEPT" /> quom, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis, quibus septem placuere colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1170</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also septendecim: septem et viginti minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et triginta annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex aut septem loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 577</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also unconnected: illum his mensibus Sex septem non vidisse proximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sex septem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.—With numerals: <cit><quote lang="la">VI. VII. diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 6</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem miracula,</quote> <trans><tr>the seven wonders of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> so, septem mira, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43722.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43722.2" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seven sages</hi> of Greece: <cit><quote lang="la">eos vero septem, quos Graeci sapientes nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Bias) sapiens habitus est unus e septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thales, qui sapientissimus in septem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43722.3" n="B" level="2"> Septem Aquae, <hi rend="ital">a lake in the Reatine territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43722.4" n="C" level="2"> Septem Stellae, for septentriones, <hi rend="ital">the seven-stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 443" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 443</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43722.5" n="D" level="2"> Septem Maria, <hi rend="ital">the lagunes at the mouth of the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Venice was afterwards founded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 16, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
september: <entryFree id="n43723" type="main" key="September"><orth extent="full" lang="la">September</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>septem; as, October, Novem-ber, Decem-ber; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 34</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n43723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the seventh month</hi> of the Roman year, reckoning from March, i. e. our ninth, <hi rend="ital">September</hi> (consisting, as now, of thirty days); <cit><quote lang="la">usually with mensis: mense Septembri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Without mensis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Mens. Monos. 9</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> Dist. 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> Quot. Kal. 8 al.—As <pos>adj.</pos>, with other substantives, <hi rend="ital">of September</hi>, <hi rend="ital">September-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendis Septembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 22</bibl></cit>; XIX. Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 14</bibl>); XIII. Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 20</bibl>), etc.... pridie Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 31</bibl>) ... Calendis Septemb.... quarto Nonas Septemb. (Sept. 2) ... Non. Septemb. (Sept. 5) ... VII. Idus Septemb. (Sept. 7) ... tertio Idus Septembris (Sept. 11) ... Id. Sept. (Sept. 13), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:57 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 57 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idibus Septembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>: Septembribus horis, <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> (unhealthy) <hi rend="ital">time of September</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 16</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
septemchordis: <entryFree id="n43724" type="main" key="septemchordis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-chordis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cordis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>chorda</etym>, <sense id="n43724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with seven strings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 3, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemdecim: <entryFree id="n43725" type="main" key="septemde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemdĕcim</orth>, v. septendecim.</entryFree>
septemfariam: <entryFree id="n43726" type="main" key="septemfa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemfārĭam</orth>, v. septifariam.</entryFree>
septemfluus: <entryFree id="n43727" type="main" key="septemflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-flŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n43727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold-flowing</hi>, an Ovidian epithet of the Nile (as having seven mouths): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:753" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 753</bibl></cit> (cf. the foll. art. and septemplex).</sense></entryFree>
septemgeminus: <entryFree id="n43728" type="main" key="septemge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-gĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus (as having seven mouths),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 800</bibl> (cf. the preced. art. and septemplex): <cit><quote lang="la">Roma (the city of seven hills),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:191" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septemgemino Roma jugo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemmestris: <entryFree id="n43729" type="main" key="septemmestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-mestris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">septĭmestris</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>, <sense id="n43729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven months</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">infans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 8, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimestris partus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
septemnerva: <entryFree id="n43730" type="main" key="septemnerva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-nerva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>septem-nervus</etym>, <sense id="n43730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> plantago, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septempedalis: <entryFree id="n43731" type="hapax" key="septempe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven feet high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemplex: <entryFree id="n43732" type="main" key="septemplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-plex</orth>, <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n43732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): clipeus (consisting of layers of ox-hides, the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">e(ptabo/eion sa/kos</foreign>, Il. 7, 220 sq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:925" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 925</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 2</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 95</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus (as having seven mouths),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 187</bibl></cit> (cf. septemfluus and septemgeminus); so, <cit><quote lang="la">Ister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 4, 128</bibl></cit>: Spiritus Sancti gratia, Ambros. Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 9, 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 20, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septempliciter: <entryFree id="n43733" type="main" key="septempli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>septemplex</etym>, <sense id="n43733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a sevenfold manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 30, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemtrio: <entryFree id="n43734" type="main" key="septemtri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemtrĭo</orth>, v. septentriones. <pb n="1675" /> <cb n="SEPT" /></entryFree>
septemvir: <entryFree id="n43735" type="main" key="septemvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvir</orth>, v. septemviri.</entryFree>
septemviralis: <entryFree id="n43736" type="main" key="septemvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septemviri</etym>, <sense id="n43736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the septemvirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septemviral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemviratus: <entryFree id="n43737" type="main" key="septemvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of the septemvirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemviri: <entryFree id="n43738" type="main" key="septemvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (-virūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n43738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college of seven men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43738.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the epulones (v. epulo, 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>; <number>sing.</number> septemvir, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2365</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43738.2" n="II" level="1"> For dividing lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 5, 14</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemzodium: <entryFree id="n43739" type="main" key="Septemzo_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septemzōdĭum</orth>, v. Septizonium.</entryFree>
septenarius: <entryFree id="n43740" type="main" key="septe_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem</etym>, <sense id="n43740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing seven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of seven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septenary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the number seven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of seven feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 514</bibl></cit> P.; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a verse consisting of seven feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tam bonos septenarios fundat ad tibiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">synthesis,</quote> <trans><tr>a service of seven goblets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 15</bibl></cit>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">of seven quadrants</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">quarter-digits</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in diameter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:41" default="NO">41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septendecim: <entryFree id="n43741" type="main" key="septende^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septendĕcim</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sep-temdĕcim</orth>; <sense id="n43741.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">M</ref></xr>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>septem - decem</etym>, <hi rend="ital">seventeen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septendecim populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl> (B. and K. XVII.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6 al.</bibl>; so freq. in Liv., acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1170</bibl> P.; cf. Drak. on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl>, and 10, 12; <cit><quote lang="la">yet in Liv., as well as in other authors, the MSS. have for the most part the numerals XVII. instead of the word.—For septendecim we have septem decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit> (B. and K. XVII.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 11, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 2</bibl></cit>, acc. to the best MSS.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">SEPTEMQVE DECEMQVE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Neap.</author> 6587</bibl></cit>; C. I. L. 5, 958; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P., septendecim was in use only among the antiqui; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 151 sq.</sense></entryFree>
septeni: <entryFree id="n43742" type="main" key="septe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n43742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> only septenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [septem]. </sense><sense id="n43742.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Seven each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a summo septenis cyathis committe hos ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo fasces, candelis involuti, septenos habuere libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 25, § 91</bibl> (dub.); 17, 10, 11, § 64.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorarum septenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri annorum senum septenumque denum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43742.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for septem, <hi rend="ital">seven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispar septenis fistula cannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 105</bibl></cit>: quā septenas temperat unda vias (<hi rend="ital">the seven mouths of the Nile</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 16; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll.: homo crescit in longitudinem ad annos usque ter septenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis septenos greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1850" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1850</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">gurgite septeno rapidus mare submovet amnis (Nilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges Nili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 185</bibl></cit>: Ister (<hi rend="ital">the seven-mouthed Danube</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:136" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 136</bibl> (cf. septemplex): <cit><quote lang="la">non removeri septeno circuitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 66, § 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septennis: <entryFree id="n43743" type="main" key="septennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. septuennis.</entryFree>
septennium: <entryFree id="n43744" type="main" key="septenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. septuennium.</entryFree>
septentrio: <entryFree id="n43745" type="main" key="septentri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septentrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. septentriones.</entryFree>
septentrionalis: <entryFree id="n43746" type="main" key="septentri^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septentrĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septentriones, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the north</hi>, <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (terrae), circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1</bibl></cit>. 2, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:16:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 70, § 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sep-tentrĭōnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the northern regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africae et Numidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septentrionarius: <entryFree id="n43747" type="hapax" key="septentri^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septentrĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">northern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septentriones: <entryFree id="n43748" type="main" key="septentri^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septentrĭōnes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">septemptrĭōnes</orth>), <itype>um</itype> (<number>sing.</number> and tmesis, <sense id="n43748.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>septemtrio;<cb n="SEPT" />  prop. the seven plough-oxen; hence, as a constellation</etym>, </sense><sense id="n43748.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the seven stars near the north pole</hi> (<hi rend="ital">called also the Wain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the Great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Little Bear</hi>): neque se septentriones quoquam in caelo commovent, Plant. Am. 1, 1, 117; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: quas nostri septem soliti vocitare Triones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:in N. D. 2:41:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. in N. D. 2, 41, 105</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gurgite caeruleo septem prohibete triones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 528</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septentrio non cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">major,</quote> <trans><tr>the Great Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor,</quote> <trans><tr>the Little Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—</sense><sense id="n43748.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43748.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The northern regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the north</hi> (as a quarter of the heavens). </sense><sense id="n43748.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis notum est, limites regionesque esse caeli quattuor: exortum, occasum, meridiem, septentriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflectens sol cursum tum ad septentriones, tum ad meridiem, aestates et hiemes efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20</bibl>; 5, 13; 7, 83; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:9" default="NO">3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:1" default="NO">3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43748.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus oriens spectat: septentrio a Macedoniā obicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:3" default="NO">2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 6 al.</bibl>—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyperboreo septem subjecta trioni Gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 381</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43748.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The north wind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43748.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eā die fuere septentriones venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43748.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer septentrio ortus inclinatum stagnum eodem, quo aestus, ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a septentrionali latere summus est aquilo, medius septentrio, imus thrascias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43748.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">northern countries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the north</hi> (as territory; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): totum paene Orientem ac Septentrionem ruinā suā involvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septenus: <entryFree id="n43749" type="main" key="septe_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. septeni.</entryFree>
septicianus: <entryFree id="n43750" type="main" key="Septi^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭcĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Septĭt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Septicius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Septician</hi>: libra, <hi rend="ital">a Septician pound</hi>, which, in the second Punic war, was reduced from twelve to eight and a half unciae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so too, argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:89:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 89, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septicollis: <entryFree id="n43751" type="hapax" key="septi^collis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭcollis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem-collis</etym>, <sense id="n43751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven-hilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing on seven hills</hi>: arx, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Rome</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 412 (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dis, quibus septem placuere colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septicus: <entryFree id="n43752" type="greek" key="se_pti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">shptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n43752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing a putrefaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 291</bibl></cit> (Jahn, smecticus): <cit><quote lang="la">dos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septies: <entryFree id="n43753" type="main" key="septi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭens</orth>), <sense id="n43753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [septem], <hi rend="ital">seven times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septies millies sestertium,</quote> <trans><tr>seven thousand times a hundred thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 213</bibl>; v. sestertius.</sense></entryFree>
septifariam: <entryFree id="n43754" type="hapax" key="septi^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭfārĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>septem-for; cf.: ambifariam, multifariam</etym>, <sense id="n43754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi>: septifariam divisum volumen, Santra ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 21</bibl> (al. septemfariam).</sense></entryFree>
septifarius: <entryFree id="n43755" type="main" key="septi^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septifolium: <entryFree id="n43756" type="hapax" key="septi^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>septem-folium</etym>, <sense id="n43756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tormentilla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septfoil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septiforis: <entryFree id="n43757" type="main" key="septi^fo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭfŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem-foris</etym>, <sense id="n43757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having seven openings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven-holed</hi> (late-Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 1, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septiformis: <entryFree id="n43758" type="main" key="septi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem-forma</etym>, <sense id="n43758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gratia Spiritus Sancti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Domin. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Domin. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, 82 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>; Hilar. in Matt. 12, 23.</sense></entryFree>
septigranius: <entryFree id="n43759" type="main" key="septi^gra_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭgrānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having seven grains; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> lathyris, Dynam. 2, 86.</sense></entryFree>
septimana: <entryFree id="n43760" type="main" key="septi^ma_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. septimanus, II. B.</entryFree>
septimanus: <entryFree id="n43761" type="main" key="septi^ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem</etym>. <sense id="n43761.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the number seven</hi>: Nonae, <hi rend="ital">falling on the seventh day of the month</hi> (in March, May, July, and October; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. quintanae, which fell upon the fifth day),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 27</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feturae,</quote> <trans><tr>born in the seventh month</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43761.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43761.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers of the seventh legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43761.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, late Lat. for hebdomas, <hi rend="ital">a week</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 5, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">die septimanarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Jewish feast of weeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmā-nărĭi</orth>, = hebdomadarii, Reg. Bened. 35.</sense></entryFree>
septimatrus: <entryFree id="n43762" type="gloss" key="septi^ma_tru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmātrūs</orth>, <itype>ŭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>septimus</etym>, <sense id="n43762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="SEPT" /> <hi rend="ital">festival celebrated seven days after the ides</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl> Müll.; and Fest. s. v. quinquatrus, pp. 255 and 257 ib.</sense></entryFree>
septimestris: <entryFree id="n43763" type="main" key="septi^mestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmestris</orth>, v. septemmestris.</entryFree>
septimius: <entryFree id="n43764" type="main" key="Septi^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭmĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n43764.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Septimius, <hi rend="ital">an augur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43764.2" n="2" level="3"> P. Septimius Scaevola, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:115 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 41, 115 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43764.3" n="3" level="3"> Porcius Septimius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43764.4" n="4" level="3"> Titius Septimius, <hi rend="ital">a poet and friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 1</bibl> (to him was addressed C. 2, 6).—</sense><sense id="n43764.5" n="5" level="3"> Septimius Severus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, Spart. Sev.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: Septimia, perh. <hi rend="ital">the wife of Sicca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septimo: <entryFree id="n43765" type="main" key="septi^mo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. septimus, I. 3.</entryFree>
septimontialis: <entryFree id="n43766" type="main" key="Septi^monti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭmontĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Septimontium, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the feast of the Seven Hills</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satio fabae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septimontium: <entryFree id="n43767" type="main" key="Septi^monti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭmontĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>septem-mons</etym>. <sense id="n43767.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The circuit of the Seven Hills</hi>, the place upon which the city of Rome afterwards stood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 41</bibl> Müll.; Fest. s. v. sacrani, p. 321 ib.; and Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 122 sq.—</sense><sense id="n43767.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The feast of the Seven Hills</hi>, celebrated at Rome in December, in commemoration of the enclosing of all the seven hills within the circuit of the city, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 24</bibl> Müll.; Fest. pp. 341 and 348 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Dec. 1</bibl>; cf. Plutarch. Q. Rom. 68.</sense></entryFree>
septimuleius: <entryFree id="n43768" type="main" key="Septi^mu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭmŭlēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n43768.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Lucius,</quote> <trans><tr>a native of Anagnia and friend of C. Gracchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septimum: <entryFree id="n43769" type="main" key="septi^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. septimus, I. 2.</entryFree>
septimus: <entryFree id="n43770" type="main" key="septi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">septŭmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n43770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [septem]. </sense><sense id="n43770.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the seventh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mense septumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimas esse aedes a portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">isque Septimus a prisci numeratur origine Beli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma condita est secundo anno Olympiadis septimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia septima decima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 27, 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also n one word, septimodecimo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit> (4) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43770.2" n="1" level="3"> Die septimi, <hi rend="ital">on the seventh day</hi> (like die crastini, noni, quinti, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi mercatum dixit esse die septimi (septimei, Ritschl),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43770.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the seventh time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius tam feliciter septimum consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43770.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmō</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n43770.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">For the seventh time</hi>: C. Marium creatum septimo consulem, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43770.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Seven times</hi> (post-class.): lavit ad diem septimo aestate vel sexto: hieme secundo vel tertio, Treb. Gall. 17; Vopisc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43770.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: septimus casus, <hi rend="ital">the instrumental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverbial</hi>, etc. <hi rend="ital">case</hi> (distinguished from the casus sextus, with prepositions), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 302</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 673</bibl> ib.; Cledon. p. 1863 ib.</sense></entryFree>
septimusdecimus: <entryFree id="n43771" type="main" key="septi^musde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭmusdĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. septimus, I.</entryFree>
septingenarius: <entryFree id="n43772" type="hapax" key="septinge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septingēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septingeni</etym>, <sense id="n43772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the number seven hundred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of seven hundred each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
septingeni: <entryFree id="n43773" type="main" key="septinge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septingēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n43773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [septingenti], <hi rend="ital">seven hundred each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracteae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septingentesimus: <entryFree id="n43774" type="hapax" key="septingente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septingentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n43774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">the seven hundredth</hi>: supra annum, Liv. prooem. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
septingenti: <entryFree id="n43775" type="main" key="septingenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septingenti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>septemcentum</etym>, <sense id="n43775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven hundred</hi>: anni, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 493 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum septingentorum memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia passuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stadia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">septingenta Tito debet Lupus (sc. sestertia),</quote> <trans><tr>seven hundred thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septingenties: <entryFree id="n43776" type="main" key="septingenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septingentĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>septingenti</etym>, <sense id="n43776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven hundred times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septinubus: <entryFree id="n43777" type="main" key="septi^nu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭnŭbus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seven times married</hi>, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 30.</sense></entryFree>
septio: <entryFree id="n43778" type="main" key="septio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septio</orth>, v. saeptio.</entryFree>
septipes: <entryFree id="n43779" type="main" key="septi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem</etym>, <sense id="n43779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfoot;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excessively tall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Burgundio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.;</hi> so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septiremis: <entryFree id="n43780" type="hapax" key="septi^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĭrēmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem-remus</etym>. <pb n="1676" /> <cb n="SEPU" /> <sense id="n43780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having seven ranges of oar-banks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (§ 19 Foss.).</sense></entryFree>
septitianus: <entryFree id="n43781" type="main" key="Septi^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septĭtĭānus</orth>, v. Septicianus.</entryFree>
septizonium: <entryFree id="n43782" type="main" key="Septizo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septizōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Septemzōdĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>septem-zona</etym>. <sense id="n43782.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A large building in Rome in the twelfth region</hi>, prob. seven stories in height, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43782.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A monument of the emperor Septimius Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the tenth region</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43782.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A building of M. Aurelius Antoninus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 3</bibl> (others consider II. and III. to have been the same building).—</sense><sense id="n43782.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The seven planets</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 7</bibl> and 19.</sense></entryFree>
septuagenarius: <entryFree id="n43783" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septuageni</etym>, <sense id="n43783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the number seventy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing seventy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septuagenarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>seventy quarter-digits broad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 56" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of seventy</tr>, <tr>a septuagenarian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septuageni: <entryFree id="n43784" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n43784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> septuagenarum, Cod. Th. 14, 4, 4, § 1), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [septuaginta], <hi rend="ital">seventy each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramides in imo latae pedum quinum septuagenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 92</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in one word, fistula septuagenumquinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 57" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 57</bibl></cit>; cf. sexageni.—</sense><sense id="n43784.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Seventy at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seventy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septuagies septuageni pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each seventieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septuageniquini: <entryFree id="n43785" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_niqui_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēniquīni</orth>, <sense id="n43785.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
septuagenus: <entryFree id="n43786" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. septuageni <sense id="n43786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
septuagesies: <entryFree id="n43787" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_si^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēsĭes</orth>, v. septuagies.</entryFree>
septuagesimus: <entryFree id="n43788" type="main" key="septu^a_ge_simus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēsimus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n43788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [septuaginta], <hi rend="ital">the seventieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septuagies: <entryFree id="n43789" type="main" key="septu^a_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgĭes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seventy times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāgēsĭes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 737</bibl> Kopp. (dub.); Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1, p. 152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, p. 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septuaginta: <entryFree id="n43790" type="main" key="septu^a_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>for septumaginta, septem-decenta</etym>, <sense id="n43790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seventy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum septuaginta,</quote> <trans><tr>a hundred and seventy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septuaginta et tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et septuaginta annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with numerals: interficiuntur IV. et LXX.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septuennis: <entryFree id="n43791" type="main" key="septu^ennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭennis</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">septennis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 21</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem-annus</etym>, <sense id="n43791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc priusquam septuennist (puer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 66</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 656.</sense></entryFree>
septuennium: <entryFree id="n43792" type="main" key="septu^enni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>septuennis</etym>, <sense id="n43792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of seven years</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=347" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 347</bibl> Müll.— Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">septennĭum</orth>, Prud. ap. Tetrast. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31, 2</bibl> Haase.</sense></entryFree>
septum: <entryFree id="n43793" type="main" key="septum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septum</orth>, v. saeptum; s. v. saepio.</entryFree>
septunx: <entryFree id="n43794" type="main" key="septunx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septunx</orth>, <itype>uncis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>septem-uncia; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl> Müll.</etym>. <sense id="n43794.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">seven twelfths</hi> of a whole (v. as, 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">jugeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <trans><tr>seven ounces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 19, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43794.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">seven things of a kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven pieces</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, in drinking,</quote> <trans><tr>seven cups</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:29" default="NO">3, 82, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septuose: <entryFree id="n43795" type="hapax" key="septu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">saep-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. saeptuosus <sense id="n43795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
septuplum: <entryFree id="n43796" type="hapax" key="septu^plum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septŭplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">i/pta/plous</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a septuple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet pro toto computari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 83" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 83 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septus: <entryFree id="n43797" type="main" key="septus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">saep-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of saepio.</entryFree>
sepulcralis: <entryFree id="n43798" type="main" key="se^pulcra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕpulcrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sepulcrum</etym>, <sense id="n43798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a tomb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchral</hi> (Ovidian): <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <trans><tr>a funeral torch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 120</bibl></cit>: area, <hi rend="ital">the funeral pyre</hi> (cf. sepulcrum, I. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 480</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sepulcretum: <entryFree id="n43799" type="hapax" key="se^pulcre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕpulcrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burialplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cemetery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sepulcretis rapere de rogo cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
