Hisp. 29, 4: auctumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 353</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla serenitas (opp. foeda tempestas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 26, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitatem praesagire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:188" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 67, 86, § 188</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinea) imbribus magis quam serenitatibus offenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43841.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43841.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serenity</hi> of fortune, of disposition, etc. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): praesentis fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor es, quam ut serenitatem meam obducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam tempestatem subitā serenitate discussit (principis ortus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43841.4" n="2" level="3"> Serenitas, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Roman emperors</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">Serene Highness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3</bibl> epil.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 286, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sereno: <entryFree id="n43842" type="main" key="se^re_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. tranquillo). </sense><sense id="n43842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu, quo caelum tempestatesque serenat (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:637" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:665" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glauca terga aquae, Claud. de Apono, 36: domum largo igne,</quote> <trans><tr>to ligth up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: luce serenanti, <hi rend="ital">in bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear daylight</hi>, * Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.—</sense><sense id="n43842.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum serenat,</quote> <trans><tr>when it is clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43842.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem fronte serenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 477</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: tristia fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:368" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 368</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serenus: <entryFree id="n43843" type="main" key="se^re_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. svar, sky; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*sei/rios</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">se/las</foreign>; Lat. sol</etym>, <sense id="n43843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the poets; cf. sudus). </sense><sense id="n43843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum tonuit laevum bene tempestate serenā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl> (Ann. v. 517 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelo sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 260</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 518</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 321</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de parte caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regione caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 528</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo perfruitur sereniore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: o nimium caelo et pelago confise sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:870" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 870</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ex tam turbido die serena et tranquilla lux rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 426</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:718" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 718</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">color (opp. nubilus),</quote> <trans><tr>bright</tr>, <tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua (with candida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a wind <hi rend="ital">that clears the sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that brings fair weather</hi>: hic Favonius serenu'st, istic Auster imbricus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 35</bibl>; hence, also, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde serenas Ventus agat nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 461</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43843.2" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serene sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair weather</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ponito pocillum in sereno noctu,</quote> <trans><tr>during a fine night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq. simply sereno: Priverni sereno per diem totum rubrum solem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare et sereno tonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl> (opp. nubilo), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 530</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquido ac puro sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitido sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie serenum cum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesique fides reditura sereni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:81" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenum nitidum micat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli serena Concutiat sonitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles et aperta serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:332" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43843.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus, tranquillus, secundus): vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1094</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">horae (with albus dies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 53</bibl></cit>: rebus serenis servare modum, <hi rend="ital">in propitious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favorable circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good fortune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:546" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons tranquilla et serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora processu facta serena tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:461" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:546" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sereno vitae tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 48, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1094</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatus (sanguis) medium quoddam serenum efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem aliquid, pulsā curarum nube serenum Vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.5" n="2" level="3"> <cb n="SERI" /> SERENVS, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi> (whose brow was always serene), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1978, 5</bibl>; cf. Serenator; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Martial calls Domitian: Jovem serenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:25:3" default="NO">9, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.6" n="3" level="3"> Serenissimus, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Roman emperors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43844" type="main" key="Se^re_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. serenus</etym>, <sense id="n43844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43844.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Serenus Sammonicus, <hi rend="ital">a physician under Septimius Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 3, 16, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43844.2" n="II" level="1"> Q. Serenus Sammonicus, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a poem</hi>, De Medicina, <hi rend="ital">still extant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. 30, 2</bibl>; cf. Teuffel's Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 379, 4.—</sense><sense id="n43844.3" n="III" level="1"> Serena, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Stilicho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother-in-law of the emperor Honorius</hi>, celebrated by Claudian in a special poem (Laus Serenae Reginae).</sense></entryFree>
seres: <entryFree id="n43845" type="main" key="Se_re^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sērĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sh=res</foreign>, <sense id="n43845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Eastern Asia</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Chinese</hi>), celebrated for their silken fabrics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:1" default="NO">3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:403 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 403 al.</bibl>—Placed by Lucan at the sources of the Nile, and made neighbors of the Ethiopians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 292</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Serum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 13</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Seras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 12</bibl>, prooem. § 2.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> Ser, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Monos. Hist. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 668" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 668</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43845.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Seres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Seric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis (Müll. Neuricus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 8; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43845.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Seric</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">silken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 8, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpenta,</quote> <trans><tr>with silken curtains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 350</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n43845.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Seric garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:38:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:11" default="NO">11, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43845.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭ-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Seric stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seresco: <entryFree id="n43846" type="hapax" key="se^resco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n43846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [serenus], <hi rend="ital">to grow dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes serescunt (opp. uvescunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 306</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43847" type="hapax" key="se^resco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n43847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [serum], <hi rend="ital">to turn to whey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac frigore serescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serestus: <entryFree id="n43848" type="main" key="Se^restus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Trojan who followed Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 611</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 487</bibl>; 9, 171 al.</sense></entryFree>
sergestus: <entryFree id="n43849" type="main" key="Sergestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sergestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steersman among the followers of Æneas;</hi> acc. to Vergil, <hi rend="ital">the ancestor of the Sergian family</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 510</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 184</bibl>; 5, 221 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sergius: <entryFree id="n43850" type="main" key="Sergi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sergĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sergĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n43850.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Sergius Catilina, <hi rend="ital">the famous conspirator.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43850.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Sergius Orata, <hi rend="ital">a notorious voluptuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43850.3" n="III" level="1"> M. Sergius, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for bravery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 3, p. 1744</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43850.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sergĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sergian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sergia tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>a tribe consisting of Sabines</tr>, <tr>Marsi</tr>, <tr>and Peligni</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15, 36</bibl></cit>; Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Corn. p. 81" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Corn. p. 81</bibl> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sergia olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 5, 6, § 20</bibl> (Jahn, Sergiana); Poll. Febr. 18, 4.—</sense><sense id="n43850.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sergĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sergian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea (named after a Sergius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seria: <entryFree id="n43851" type="main" key="se_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cylindrical earthen vessel</hi> for preserving liquids, fruit, salted provisions, etc., <hi rend="ital">a large jar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">relevi omnia dolia, omnes serias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:206" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serica: <entryFree id="n43852" type="main" key="se_ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Seres <sense id="n43852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sericarius: <entryFree id="n43853" type="main" key="se_ri^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sericus</etym>, <sense id="n43853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to silks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">textor, Firm. Math. 8: NEGOCIATOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1368</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4252</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43853.1" n="A" level="2"> SERICARII, <hi rend="ital">silk - dealers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 713, 346</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43853.2" n="B" level="2"> <itype>SERICARIA, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slave who took care of silk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2955</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sericatus: <entryFree id="n43854" type="hapax" key="se_ri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in Seric stuffs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dressed in silks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sericeus: <entryFree id="n43855" type="spur" key="se_ri^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for sericis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl>.) <pb n="1679" /> <cb n="SERI" /></entryFree>
serichatum: <entryFree id="n43856" type="hapax" key="seri^cha_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serĭchātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aromatic plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sericoblatta: <entryFree id="n43857" type="main" key="se_ri^coblatta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭco-blatta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sericus</etym>, <sense id="n43857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment of purple silk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 8, 10</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 20, 13; 10, 20, 18.</sense></entryFree>
sericum: <entryFree id="n43858" type="main" key="se_ri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Seres <sense id="n43858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sericus: <entryFree id="n43859" type="main" key="Se_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Seres, 1.</entryFree>
series: <entryFree id="n43860" type="main" key="se^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrĭes</orth> (no <sense id="n43860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>dat.</case>), <itype>em, ē</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. sero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a row</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">series; a chain</hi> of things fastened or holding together (syn. ordo). </sense><sense id="n43860.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43860.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly post - class.; not in Cic.); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">series vinculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">structurae dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe porrecta viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum (in dancing),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis nepotum A Belo series,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:88" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixa series capillorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreae laminae serie inter se conexae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:21" default="NO">7, 3, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43860.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a series</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, etc. (class., but for the most part only in the <number>sing.</number>). </sense><sense id="n43860.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio seriesque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum est ordo seriesque causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 55, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum est sempiterna quaedam series rerum et catena, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum sententiarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta series artis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:39:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 39, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in complexu loquendi serieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longissima rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 114, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of time (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilis annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per longam saeculorum seriem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantā saeculorum serie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tam longam seriem annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:19:1" default="NO">4, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis temporum series ex historiis colligatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulantes fictas litium, series,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43860.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera series deinde sequitur, majora nectens, ut haec: Si homo est, animal est, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae bene composita erunt, memoriam serie sua ducent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec erit aeternae series ab origine Romae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 140, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of the connection of words: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum series juncturaque pollet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 242</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43860.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an unbroken line of descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ab Jove tertius Ajax. Nec tamen haec series in causā prosit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digne vir hac serie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serie fulcite genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serietas: <entryFree id="n43861" type="main" key="se_ri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serius</etym>, <sense id="n43861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gravity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriousness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 13, 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serilia: <entryFree id="n43862" type="hapax" key="se^ri_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. sero</etym>, <sense id="n43862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ropes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cordage</hi>: spartea, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 251 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
serio: <entryFree id="n43863" type="main" key="se_ri^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. serius <sense id="n43863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
seriola: <entryFree id="n43864" type="main" key="se_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>seria</etym>, <sense id="n43864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small jar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:29" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seriphus: <entryFree id="n43865" type="main" key="Se^ri_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrīphus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*se/ri=fos</foreign>, <sense id="n43865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small rocky island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckoned among the Cyclades</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Serfo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 251</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:564" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:170" default="NO">10, 170</bibl> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrīphĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Seriphian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 29, § 53</bibl></cit> (Jahn, seriphum); <cit><quote lang="la">32, 9, 31, § 100 (Jahn, seriphum): saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrīphĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Seriphian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seris: <entryFree id="n43866" type="main" key="se^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">se/ris</foreign>, <sense id="n43866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of endive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 32, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 5</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
serisapia: <entryFree id="n43867" type="hapax" key="se_ri^sa^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭsăpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serus-sapio</etym>, <sense id="n43867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a dish</hi> invented by Petronius, perh. with allusion to the proverb: <cit><quote lang="la">sero sapiunt (v. sapio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seritas: <entryFree id="n43868" type="main" key="se_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serus</etym>, <sense id="n43868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">'late arrival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:28" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serius: <entryFree id="n43869" type="main" key="se_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for sevrius; root sev-, severus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">se/bas, semno/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, opp. to sportive, jocular (class. only of things; <cit><quote lang="la">severus, both of persons and things): res (opp. jocosae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo (opp. jocus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non res potissimum seria, sed quasi ludus ac jocus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: graves<cb n="SERM" />  seriaeque res, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res serias omnis extollo in alium diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait rem seriam Velle agere mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies religiosus ad agendum quicquam rei seriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 17 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 82</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 25, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinor hercle hodie quod ego dixi per jocum, Id eventurum esse et severum et serium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid serium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam grave ac serium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba seria dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 107</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">earnestness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriousness; serious matters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi> (often opp. jocus); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid per jocum Dixi, nolito in serium convortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque res in serium versa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad serium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīcum joca, seria, ut dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joca atque seria cum humillimis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his seria ac jocos celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per seria per jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen amoto quaeramus seria ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:341 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 341 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea (opp. lusus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Marsus) seria partitur in tria genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille seria nostra, ille deliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, for severus (ante- and post-class.): non ego te novi tristem servum, serium? Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 33, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos serios aspernatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 98, p. 336, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 278 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 6, 1</bibl>; Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 12, 5</bibl>; Mam. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Act. 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 15, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n43869.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in earnest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriously</hi> (mostly anteclass.; a favorite word of Plaut.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): nec joco nec serio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid dictum est per jocum, Non aequom est id te serio praevortier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an id joco dixisti? equidem serio ac vero ratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so (opp. joco) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 3</bibl>: vereor serio, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:14" default="NO">9, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43869.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in earnest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(post-class.) vultu serie pulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43870" type="main" key="se_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭus</orth>, <sense id="n43870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. adv.</hi>, v. 3. sero.</sense></entryFree>
seriva: <entryFree id="n43871" type="spur" key="seriva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seriva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a false read. for serieve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 2, § 3</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
sermo: <entryFree id="n43872" type="main" key="sermo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. sero, qs. serta, conserta oratio</etym>, <sense id="n43872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">talking</hi> with any one; <hi rend="ital">talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo est a serie: sermo enim non potest in uno homine esse solo, sed ubi oratio cum altero conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll. (very freq. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n43872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43872.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (syn. colloquium): quoniam magna vis orationis est eaque duplex, altera contentionis, altera sermonis: contentio disceptationibus tribuatur judiciorum, contionum, senatus: sermo in circulis, disputationibus, congressionibus familiarium versetur; <cit><quote lang="la">sequatur etiam convivia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi servus sermonem serat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa inter sese vario sermone serebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem nobiscum ibi copulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sermones fabulandi conferant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 34: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et pes sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea tu sermonem nec joco nec serio Tibi habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi illa cum sermonem occipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sermones caedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem cum aliquo conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris sermonibus collocutionibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mature veniunt, discumbitur: fit sermo inter eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum longior consulto ab Ambiorige instituitur sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis aditum cum aliquo habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum tibi omnino cum Albinovano sermonem ullā de re fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 296</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in ore, in sermone omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: memini in eum sermonem illum incidere, qui tum <cb n="SERM" /> fere multis erat in ore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivam sermone benigno tendere noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre sermones deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 71</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliantibus divis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">et euntem multa loquendo Detinuit sermone diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc inter eos tu sermo es,</quote> <trans><tr>you are the talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit> (3, 14), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundus est mihi sermo litterarum tuarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the conversing with you by letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">littera sermonis fida ministra mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43872.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43872.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Literary conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discussion</hi> (cf. oratio): tum Furius: Quid vos agitis? num sermonem vestrum aliquem diremit noster interventus? Minime vero, Africanus; <cit><quote lang="la">soles enim tu haec studiose investigare, quae sunt in hoc genere, de quo instituerat paulo ante Tubero quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonem ingredi (just before: in disputationem ingredi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Scaevola) exposuit nobis sermonem Laelii de amicitiā habitum ab illo secum ... Ejus disputationis sententias memoriae mandavi, etc.... ut tamquam a praesentibus haberi sermo videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus his, de quibus hic sermo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feci sermonem inter nos habitum in Cumano. Tibi dedi partes Antiochinas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (circulo) de philosophiā sermo haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratici sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:26" default="NO">2, 15, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longum sermonem me vocas, Attice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc enim sermo de naturā est,</quote> <trans><tr>our subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1</bibl>, pr. § 2; 16, 32, 58, § 134; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43872.5" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi> (more informal and unpretending than oratio): <cit><quote lang="la">meos multos et illustres et ex superiore et ex aequo loco sermones habitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43872.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ordinary speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the language of conversation</hi> (opp. contentio): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo est oratio remissa et finitima cottidianae locutioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis est oratio philosophorum et umbratilis, etc.... Itaque sermo potius quam oratio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>: in argumentis Caecilius poscit palmam, in sermonibus Plautus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in dialogue</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 374, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta oratio, qualis in sermone et epistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Piso, statarius et sermonis plenus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis scribat, uti nos, Sermoni propiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem sermoni proximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:162" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut litigantes quoque a sermone incipiant, ad vociferationem transeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of prose as opposed to poetry: <cit><quote lang="la">comoedia ... nisi quod pede certo Differt sermoni sermo merus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tragicus plerumque dolet sermone pedestri Telephus et Peleus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43872.7" n="b" level="4"> Concr., of verses in a conversational style, <hi rend="ital">a satire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (delectatur) Bioneis sermonibus et sale nigro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albi, nostrorum sermonum candide judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sermones ego mallem Repentes per humum quam res componere gestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43872.8" n="3" level="3"> With reference to some particular object, <hi rend="ital">common talk</hi> respecting any thing, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fama, rumor): vulgi sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc per urbem solus sermo est omnibus, Eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo est totā Asiā dissipatus, Cn. Pompeium, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi venit in mentem multum fore sermonem, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istiusmodi sermones ad te delati de me sunt, non debuisti credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonem hominum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audita et percelebrata sermonibus res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix feram sermones hominum, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae perigrinantur aures, neque in hoc pervagato civitatis sermone versantur,</quote> <trans><tr>this talk of the town</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerato jam levissimo sermone hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones inimicorum effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones lacessere, reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: retudit sermones, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne putet aliquid oratione meā sermonis in sese aut invidiae esse quaesitum,</quote> <trans><tr>of slander</tr>, <tr>calumny</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabimus sermonem iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>give them something to talk about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">materiam sermonibus praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: cataplus ille Puteolanus, sermo illius temporis, Cic. <pb n="1680" /> <cb n="SERO" /> Rab. Post. 14, 40 B. and K. dub.; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43872.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a manner of speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode of expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diction</hi>, etc. (cf. lingua): <cit><quote lang="la">sermone eo debemus uti, qui notus est nobis, ne, ut quidam Graeca verba inculcantes jure optimo rideamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Terentii) fabellae propter elegantiam sermonis putabantur a C. Laelio scribi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sane quid est aliud vetus sermo quam vetus loquendi consuetudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:3" default="NO">12, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43872.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the speech</hi> of a nation, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Catulo) non solum nos Latini sermonis, sed etiam Graeci ipsi solent suae linguae subtilitatem elegantiamque concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Latino sermone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae philosophi Graeco sermone tractavissent, ea Latinis litteris mandaremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrii sermonis egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 832</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lingua Catonis et Enni Sermonem patrium ditaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, quae sermonem imitantur humanum ... Agrippina turdum habuit imitantem sermones hominum ... lusciniae Graeco atque Latino sermone dociles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43872.11" n="C" level="2"> Of a single expression: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis ita legaverit: Fructus annuos, etc., perinde accipi debet hic sermo, ac si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:2:section=1" default="NO">11, 7, 2, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:29" default="NO">28, 5, 29</bibl>.— Hence, of a single word (late Lat.): <foreign lang="greek">de/os</foreign> sermo Graecus est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sermocinanter: <entryFree id="n43873" type="main" key="sermo_ci^nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sermocinor <sense id="n43873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sermocinatio: <entryFree id="n43874" type="main" key="sermo_ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sermocinor</etym>, <sense id="n43874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discussion</hi> (very rare): sermones hominum assimulatos dicere <foreign lang="greek">dialo/gous</foreign> malunt, quod Latinorum quidam dixerunt sermocinationem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermocinatio alicujus aliquā de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermocinatio est, cum alicui personae sermo attribuitur et is exponitur cum ratione dignitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 43, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sermocinator: <entryFree id="n43875" type="main" key="sermo_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a babbler</hi>, Fulg. Rasp. contra Serm. Fast<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sermocinatrix: <entryFree id="n43876" type="main" key="sermo_ci^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sermocinator</etym>, <sense id="n43876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that converses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted to conversation;</hi> in rhet. lang., as a part of rhetoric, a transl. of the Platonic <foreign lang="greek">prosomilhtikh/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl>.—In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">immodica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a prattler</tr>, <tr>babbler</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sermocino: <entryFree id="n43877" type="main" key="sermo_ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, collat. form of sermocinor, q. v.</entryFree>
sermocinor: <entryFree id="n43878" type="main" key="sermo_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n43878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [sermo]. </sense><sense id="n43878.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To talk with</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to parley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi> about any thing (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. colloquor): consuetudo sermocinandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">psittaci etiam sermocinantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭno</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 39, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43878.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (acc. to sermo, I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">to hold a literary conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discuss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisitius sermocinari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluria forte quis dixit sermocinans vir apprime doctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōcĭnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in discourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas extrahere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sermonalis: <entryFree id="n43879" type="hapax" key="sermo_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sermonari: <entryFree id="n43880" type="gloss" key="sermo_na_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermōnāri</orth> <itype>rusticius videtur</itype>, sed rectius; <sense id="n43880.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sermocinari crebrius est, sed corruptius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sermunculus: <entryFree id="n43881" type="main" key="sermuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sermuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sermo</etym>. <sense id="n43881.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to sermo, I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">Common talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tittletattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbani sermunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermunculis fabellisque duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermunculum omnem aut restinxerit aut sedarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deterreor sermunculis istorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43881.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little discourse</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 32, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serniosus: <entryFree id="n43882" type="main" key="serni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sernĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <sense id="n43882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with an eruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serniosi, quos nos petiginosos dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
