sero: <entryFree id="n43883" type="main" key="se^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, sătum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for seso, root sa-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/w, sh/qw</foreign>, to sift</etym>, <sense id="n43883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: planto, semino, consero). </sense><sense id="n43883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case>, either of the plant, seed, etc., sown, or of the land cultivated: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tempus erit, effodito seritoque recte ... Quae diligentius seri voles, in calicibus seri oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 133, 2</bibl></cit>: serendum viciam, lentem, cicerculam, etc., <cb n="SERO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam et vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tantum decumae sit, quantum severis: hoc est, ut quot jugera sint sata, totidem medimna decumae debeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri molliti et oblimati ad serendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>: serit arbores, quae alteri saeculo prosint, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam sacrā vite prius severis arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 193</bibl></cit>: surculos, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in inculto et derelicto solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste serendus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera ratio serendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 224</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa erant inter eum locum manu sata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe satas alio vidi traducere messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 176</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">standing corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 454</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi istic nec seritur nec metitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I have no benefit from it</tr>, <tr>it's nothing to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43883.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">begotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprung forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tertullae nollem abortum: tam enim Cassii sunt jam quam Bruti serendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere nec fortuito sati et creati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic satus ad pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: ex Tantalo ortus Pelops, ex Pelope autem satus Atreus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 57</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilia cum Lauso de Numitore sati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 54</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largo satos Curetas ab imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 282</bibl></cit>.—With simple <case>abl.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Camertem Magnanimo Volscente satum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole satus Phaëthon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata Tiresiā Manto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 157</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sate sanguine divum,</quote> <trans><tr>sprung from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sanguine humano sed stirpe divinā satum se esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o sate gente deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matre satos unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 141</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">matre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:799" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 799</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Nereide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchum vocant satumque iterum solumque bimatrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.— Hence, satus (sata) aliquo, for <hi rend="ital">a son</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">daughter</hi>) of any one: <cit><quote lang="la">satus Anchisa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 424</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 331</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 152: Hammone satus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Iarbas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satae Peliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sati Curibus,</quote> <trans><tr>sprung from</tr>, <tr>natives of Cures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:778" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 778</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43883.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sow the seeds</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disseminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propagate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges, instituta, rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnam rem publicam,</quote> <trans><tr>to found</tr>, <tr>establish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere vulnera vasta serebant,</quote> <trans><tr>scattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1290</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera pugnantis tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:235" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hamilcar) Romanum sevit puerili in pectore bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civiles discordias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam discordiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina in senatum apud infimae plebis homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi causas sollicitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43884" type="main" key="se^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ui</orth>), <itype>tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sarat, thread; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">seira/</foreign>, rope; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rw, e(/rma, o(/rmos</foreign>; Lat. series, servus</etym>, <sense id="n43884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entwine</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n43884.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">accipiunt sertas nardo florente coronas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 254, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 121, 131: <cit><quote lang="la">loricae,</quote> <trans><tr>linked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 421</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43884.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">serta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wreaths of flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garlands</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arae sertis recentibus halant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae, serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1174" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:14" default="NO">1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:52" default="NO">1, 7, 52</bibl> et saep. al.—Rarely in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseo Venus aurea serto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6, 88</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">serta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. corona): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tua praependent demissae in pocula sertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 37; id. et Corn. Sev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 83</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n43884.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave; to combine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi> (class. but rare; syn.: jungo, cieo, instruo): seritote<cb n="SERP" />  diem concorditer ambo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">alternate according to the succession</hi> (in the government), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 177</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 110 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex aeternitate causa causam serens,</quote> <trans><tr>joining in order</tr>, <tr>following</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (fati) lege immobilis rerum humanarum ordo seritur,</quote> <trans><tr>is arranged</tr>, <tr>disposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella ex bellis serendo,</quote> <trans><tr>by joining war to war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 20</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum ex tumultu, bellum ex bello serunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit> ib.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina cum Patribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to join</tr>, <tr>engage in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: quod mihi servus sermonem serat, <hi rend="ital">joins speech</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bandies words with me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa inter sese vario sermone serebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 38</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:941" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 941</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sermonibus occultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta colloquia cum eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populares orationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to put together</tr>, <tr>compose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Livius) ab saturis ausus est primus argumento fabulam serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid seris fando moras?</quote> <trans><tr>why are you contriving?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 281" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>, <tr>prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 339</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43885" type="main" key="se_ro3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sera</etym>, <sense id="n43885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten with a bolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bar</hi>: praeda nullo obstaculo serata, Ven. Fort. Vit. S. Menard. 6; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 837</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43886" type="main" key="se_ro_^4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērō^</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. serus <sense id="n43886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
serotinus: <entryFree id="n43887" type="main" key="se_ro_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>4. sero</etym>, econom. t. t. of the Aug. period, for the class. serus. <sense id="n43887.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that comes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happens late</hi>, <hi rend="ital">late-ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">late</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementis (opp. festinata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 15, 17, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes (opp. tempestiva frigora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae (opp. tempestivae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca (opp. praecocia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber serotinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the later rainy season</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 11, 14</bibl></cit>; id. Osee, 6, 3.— </sense><sense id="n43887.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">in the evening</hi> (cf. serus, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">matutinus et serotinus imber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43887.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">raptor (puellae),</quote> <trans><tr>stealing late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Decl. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Decl. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
serpens: <entryFree id="n43888" type="main" key="serpens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. serpo <sense id="n43888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
serpentaria: <entryFree id="n43889" type="main" key="serpenta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpentārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [serpens], <sense id="n43889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snakeweed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> veperina, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serpentigena: <entryFree id="n43890" type="hapax" key="serpenti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpentĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>serpens-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n43890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serpent-born</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sprung from a serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serpentinus: <entryFree id="n43891" type="main" key="serpenti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serpens</etym>, <sense id="n43891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a serpent</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: serpentinos natos, Aug. Gen. contra Manich. 2, 26.</sense></entryFree>
serpentipes: <entryFree id="n43892" type="hapax" key="serpenti^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpentĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>serpens-pes</etym>, <sense id="n43892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serpent-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gigantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serperastra: <entryFree id="n43893" type="main" key="serpe^rastra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpĕrastra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">serpĭr-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. from serpo - rastrum, creepingsplints</etym>, <sense id="n43893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knee-splints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knee-bandages</hi> for straightening the crooked legs of children. * </sense><sense id="n43893.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris in geniculis alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n43893.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, humorously of officers, who hold the soldiers in check: <cit><quote lang="la">de serperastris cohortis meae nihil est quod doleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serpillum: <entryFree id="n43894" type="main" key="serpillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. serpyllum.</entryFree>
serpo: <entryFree id="n43895" type="main" key="serpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype> (serpsit antiqui pro serpserit usi sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root serp, kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">e(/rpw</foreign>, repo</etym>, <sense id="n43895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43895.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only of animals; while repo is also used of persons who creep or go slowly; <cit><quote lang="la">v. repo, I.): serpere anguiculos, nare anaticulas, evolare merulas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia animalia gradiendo, alia serpendo ad pastum accedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes quasdam (bestias), quasdam esse gradientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) per humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipera imā humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draco In platanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentia secla ferarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the serpents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 766</bibl></cit>.—In late Lat. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra nullo serpatur angue,</quote> <trans><tr>was crawled over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43895.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to move slowly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperceptibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed gradually</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">has (stellas) inter, torvus Draco serpit, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106: sol serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 690</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of streams: an te, Cydne, canam, qui leniter ... placidis per vada serpis aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>creepest</tr>, <tr>windest along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in freta vicina Numicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 598</bibl></cit>: Ister tectis <pb n="1681" /> <cb n="SERP" /> in mare serpit aquis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sicco serpentem pulvere rivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 974</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae serpunt per vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:608" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistit sacer ignis et urit corpore serpens,</quote> <trans><tr>slowly spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 660</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flamma per continua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus aetheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 523</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1120" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1120</bibl> (with repere): <cit><quote lang="la">fallacem patriae serpere dixit equum (Trojanum),</quote> <trans><tr>was creeping along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 64.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis serpens multiplici lapsu et erratico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lithospermos (herba) jacet atque serpit humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liber per colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules per terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 59, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 58, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine tempora circum Inter victrices hederam tibi serpere lauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 13</bibl></cit>; Laber. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:119" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 119</bibl>.—Of the growth of the hair: <cit><quote lang="la">per tua lanugo cum serpere coeperit ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 641</bibl></cit>.—Of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">dein per continua serpens (flamma) omnia incendio hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ipsi (ignes) serpere possunt quo cibus vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 523</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 660</bibl>.—Of disease, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulcus latius atque altius serpit,</quote> <trans><tr>gradually spreads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira contagia per vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 826</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcinoma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra lues in vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:79:2 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 79, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per membra senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43895.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl; to extend gradually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperceptibly; to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi> (a favorite trope of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim serpit, sed volat in optimum statum res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpere occulte coepisti nihil dum aliis suspicantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hoc malum) obscure serpens multas jam provincias occupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit deinde res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne latius serperet res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit nescio quo modo per omnium vitas amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si semel suscipimus genus hoc argumenti, attende quo serpat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam facile serpat injuria et peccandi consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit hic rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama per coloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per agmina murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:168" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 11, 13, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpente latius bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9:4" default="NO">2, 9, 4</bibl>.—Of a low, grovelling poetic style: <cit><quote lang="la">(poëta) Serpit humi tutus,</quote> <trans><tr>crawls along the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 28</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones Repentes per humum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 251</bibl></cit>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">serpens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> serpentium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl>; but also, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and later, serpentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 436</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 848</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:608 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 608 al.</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (sc. bestia); less freq. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and eccl. Lat., <gen>m.</gen> (sc. draco), <hi rend="ital">a creeping thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a creeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawler</hi> (cf. reptilis). </sense><sense id="n43895.4" n="A" level="2"> <foreign lang="greek">*kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a snake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi> (syn.: anguis, coluber); <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam serpentes ortae extra aquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 447</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 652</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 4 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 273</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 753</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 324</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 5</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">igniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 21, 6</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In apposition with draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>.— Also <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> serpentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43895.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Serpent</hi>, as a constellation. </sense><sense id="n43895.6" n="a" level="4"> Between the Great and the Little Bear, = anguis and draco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43895.7" n="b" level="4"> In the hand of Ophiuchus (Anguitenens, Anguifer), = anguis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:13" default="NO">3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43895.8" n="B" level="2"> A creeping insect on the human body, <hi rend="ital">a louse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 354, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serpula: <entryFree id="n43896" type="main" key="serpu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serpo</etym>, <sense id="n43896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little snake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, Messal. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351, 13</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=350:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 350, 2</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
serpullum: <entryFree id="n43897" type="main" key="serpullum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpullum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. serpyllum <sense id="n43897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
serpyllifer: <entryFree id="n43898" type="hapax" key="serpylli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpyllĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serpyllum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n43898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thyme-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
serpyllum: <entryFree id="n43899" type="main" key="serpyllum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serpyllum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">serpillum</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 103</bibl> Müll. p. 30 Bip.; and in MSS. of <cb n="SERT" /> Cato, R. R. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">serpull-</orth>; <sense id="n43899.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">U</ref></xr>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sibilated from <foreign lang="greek">e(/rpullon</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">thyme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wildthyme</hi>: Thymus serpyllum, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:39" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 90, § 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
serra: <entryFree id="n43900" type="main" key="serra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. = sec - ra, seg - ra, from seco</etym>. <sense id="n43900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A saw</hi>, the invention of Daedalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor serrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arguta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 143</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">serram ducere cum aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>to quarrel with one about something</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, quamdiu per hanc lineam serram reciprocabimus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 3</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the back of a thin person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43900.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43900.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sawfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43900.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A serrated order of battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serra proeliari dicitur, cum assidue acceditur recediturque neque ullo consistitur tempore. Cato de re militari: Sive opus est cuneo, aut globo, aut forcipe aut turribus aut serrā uti adoriare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43900.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A threshingwain</hi>, with serrated wheels, Hier. in Amos, 1; Vulg. lsa. 28, 27.—</sense><sense id="n43900.5" n="D" level="2"> Serra, in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">the name of the Tiber</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serrabilis: <entryFree id="n43901" type="hapax" key="serra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n43901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be sawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrabilia ac sectilia (ligna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serraculum: <entryFree id="n43902" type="main" key="serra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steering-oar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">phda/lion</foreign>, clavus navis, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29, § 2</bibl> dub. (others, servaculum or feraculum).</sense></entryFree>
serracum: <entryFree id="n43903" type="main" key="serra_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrācum</orth>, v. sarracum.</entryFree>
serrago: <entryFree id="n43904" type="main" key="serra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n43904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sawdust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
serranus: <entryFree id="n43905" type="main" key="Serra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Serrānus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarānus</orth>, e. g. SEX. ATILIVS M. F. SARANVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3110</bibl>; hence, to be derived from Saranum, an Umbrian city), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi> (agnomen) <hi rend="ital">of C. Atilius Regulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was summoned from the plough to the consulship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 844</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 414</bibl>.—Of other Atilii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
serrapilli: <entryFree id="n43906" type="main" key="Serrapilli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Serrapilli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pannonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Danube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serratim: <entryFree id="n43907" type="main" key="serra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n43907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of a saw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a saw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scissa folia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serratorius: <entryFree id="n43908" type="main" key="serra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serro</etym>, <sense id="n43908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sawshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serrate;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sawing</hi>- (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in modum serratoriae machinae conecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serratula: <entryFree id="n43909" type="main" key="serra_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrātŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Italian name for betony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serratura: <entryFree id="n43910" type="main" key="serra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serro</etym>, <sense id="n43910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sawing up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serratus: <entryFree id="n43911" type="main" key="serra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n43911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sawshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serrated</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus (foliorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compages (ossium capitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 48, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus (anseris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136, 4</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">serrā-ti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (sc. nummi), <hi rend="ital">silver coins notched on the edge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Eckh. Doctr. Num. 5, p. 94 sq.</sense></entryFree>
serretes: <entryFree id="n43912" type="main" key="Serretes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Serretes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pannonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Danube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serrheum: <entryFree id="n43913" type="main" key="Serrhe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Serrhēum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rhīum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rīum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a fortification</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia castella, Cypsela et Doriscon et Serrheum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Form Serrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serro: <entryFree id="n43914" type="main" key="serro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n43914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to saw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to saw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saw in pieces</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pali serrantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 41, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Isa. 4, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serrula: <entryFree id="n43915" type="main" key="serru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small saw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ossis serrulā praecidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem serrulā desecare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubriata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serta: <entryFree id="n43916" type="main" key="serta" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serta</orth>, <itype>ōrum and ae</itype>, v. 2. sero, I. B.</entryFree>
sertacampanica: <entryFree id="n43917" type="main" key="serta Campa_ni^ca" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">serta Campānĭca</orth>, or simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">serta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> melilotos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">113</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">ser-tŭla Campāna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sertatus: <entryFree id="n43918" type="hapax" key="serta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sertātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. serta; v. 2. <cb n="SERU" /> sero, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n43918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wreathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garlanded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput regali majestate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, § 426</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sertor: <entryFree id="n43919" type="gloss" key="Sertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Latin prœnomen</hi> [of disputed origin; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. 2. sero],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340, 22</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Auct. Praenom. post <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:page=746" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> p. 746</bibl> Kempf.</sense></entryFree>
sertorius: <entryFree id="n43920" type="main" key="Serto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sertōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> So, Q. Sertorius, <hi rend="ital">a general of Marius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who maintained himself for a long while in Spain against the partisans of Sylla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was finally assassinated by Perperna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 549</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 54</bibl> sqq. Dietsch.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sertōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sertorius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sertorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:64" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 58, § 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sertula: <entryFree id="n43921" type="main" key="sertu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sertŭla Campāna</orth>, v. 2. serta.</entryFree>
sertum: <entryFree id="n43922" type="main" key="sertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. sero, I. B.</entryFree>
sertus: <entryFree id="n43923" type="main" key="sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. sero.</entryFree>
serum: <entryFree id="n43924" type="main" key="se^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrū</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 23</bibl> P.) [prob. sibilated from <foreign lang="greek">o)ro/s</foreign>]. <sense id="n43924.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The watery part of curdled milk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 33, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 406</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:770" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 770</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43924.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like <foreign lang="greek">o)ro/s</foreign>, of <hi rend="ital">the watery parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serum</hi>, of other things; <cit><quote lang="la">of resin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminis genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serus: <entryFree id="n43925" type="main" key="se_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. series; Sanscr. sărat, thread; that which is long drawn out</etym>, <sense id="n43925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">late</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: tardus, lentus): nescis quid vesper serus vehat (the title of a work by Varro), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:1" default="NO">13, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sero a vespere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:400" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:651" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, B.): <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ripe years</tr>, <tr>age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 63</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta deūm Tarda et sera nimis, id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64: nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: sera eruditio, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">o)yimaqi/an</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of persons, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: o seri studiorum! <hi rend="ital">ye late-learned</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)yimaqei=s</foreign> (i. e. backward, ignorant), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 21</bibl> (v. infra, b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): ulmus, <hi rend="ital">late</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">slowly-growing</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 144</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>late in bearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. serotinus, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> under <hi rend="ital">sup.—Comp.</hi> (rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. <pos>adv.</pos> infra <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">serior mors (opp. maturior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe omnium serius bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serior putatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:15" default="NO">2, 10, 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for posterior: <cit><quote lang="la">serior aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">successores quam serissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serissima omnium (pirorum) Amerina, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>ripening the latest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl></cit>; cf. supra.—</sense><sense id="n43925.1" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43925.2" n="(a)" level="5"> For the <pos>adv.</pos> sero, of one who does any thing late: <cit><quote lang="la">serus in caelum redeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serus Graecis admovit acumina chartis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusserit ad se Maecenas serum sub lumina prima venire Convivam,</quote> <trans><tr>late in the day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nisi serus abi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena tamen tacitis sera venit pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(me) Arguit incepto serum accessisse labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 297</bibl></cit>.—So with things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">sera rubens accendit lumina Vesper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imposita est sero tandem manus ultima bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seros pedes assumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cantaber serā domitus catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serum ut veniamus ad amnem Phasidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:708" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 708</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o seri studiorum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit> (v. supra); so, <cit><quote lang="la">belli serus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 255</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur serus versare boves et plaustra Bootes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 35.—</sense><sense id="n43925.3" n="(b)" level="5"> For adverb. use of sera and serum, v. <pos>adv.</pos> infra.—</sense><sense id="n43925.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> ‡ </sense><sense id="n43925.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. hora), <hi rend="ital">a late hour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the evening hour</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e(spe/ra</foreign>, sera, vespra, crepusculum, Gloss. Vet.—</sense><sense id="n43925.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">late time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">late hour</hi> (of the day or night; first in Liv.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in the historians): serum erat diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia serum diei fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque sero diei subducit ex acie legionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahebatur in quam maxime serum diei certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 2</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in serum noctis convivium productum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: ad serum<pb n="1682" /> <cb n="SERU" />  usque diem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, in Sueton., of <hi rend="ital">a late hour</hi> of the day: <cit><quote lang="la">in serum dimicatione protractā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in serum usque patente cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43925.7" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">too late</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut magis exoptatae Kalendae Januariae quam serae esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque rectae voluntati serum est tempus ullum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus cavendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 487" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 487</bibl></cit>: bellum, Sall. Fragm. ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiates serum auxilium post proelium venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:562" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbum consilium serum, ut debuit, fuit: et jam profectus Virginius erat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redit Alcidae jam sera cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:247" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seras conditiones pacis tentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tandem ex somno surrexissent, in quod serum erat, aliquot horas remis in naves collocandis absumpserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>which was too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc serum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; and with a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum deliberamus, quando incipiendum sit, incipere jam serum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">serum est, advocare iis rebus affectum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43925.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for the adverb (cf. supra, I. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">tum decuit metuisse tuis: nunc sera querelis Haud justis assurgis,</quote> <trans><tr>too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad possessa venis praeceptaque gaudia serus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculeas jam serus opes spretique vocabis Arma viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:713" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serā ope vincere fata Nititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:562" default="NO"><author>Val.
