Grut.</author> 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes quattuor amissis servatae a peste carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 699</bibl></cit>.—Usu. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ex judicio te ulla salus servare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs ex omni impetu regio servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem ex hieme marique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43947.4" n="b" level="4"> With abstract objects: navorum imperium servare est induperantum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 413 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 41</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem laboris quietisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia indiligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodias neglegenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimina rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentum (fides),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenorem pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides juris jurandi saepe cum hoste servanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem de numero dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilitatem juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura induciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum militare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 89: rectum animi, Hor S. 2, 3, 201: consulta patrum, leges juraque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam summā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis verecundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequam mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:159" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi> for the future or for some purpose (syn. reservare): <cit><quote lang="la">si voles servare (vinum) in vetustatem, ad alvum movendam servato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum Massicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecuba centum clavibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis chernites mitior est servandis corporibus nec absumendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermes in melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se temporibus aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo me servavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valerius, in parvis rebus neglegens ultor gravem se ad majora vindicem servabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet esse quasdam res servatas judicio voluntatique multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod tempus quam integerrimas vires militi servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis auribus ista (carmina) Servas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa integra Caesari servaretur, Auct. B. Alex. 35, 1: durate et vosmet rebus servate secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 207</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Herculeos servaberis arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the idea of the attention being turned to any thing). </sense><sense id="n43947.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give heed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay attention to; to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> any thing (syn. observo). </sense><sense id="n43947.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43947.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: uxor scelesta <cb n="SERV" /> me omnibus servat modis, Ne, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palinurus dum sidera servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem locumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis limen servantis alumnae,</quote> <trans><tr>keeping watch over</tr>, <tr>guarding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:383" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascentes haedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servaturis vigili Capitolia voce Cederet anseribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 538</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pomaria dederat servanda draconi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:646" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 646</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> or final: quid servas, quo eam, quid agam? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 387, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus servus servet, Venerine eas (coronas) det, an viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decemviri servassent, ut unus fasces haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servandum in eo ante omnia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 28, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (triumviri) servarent, ne qui nocturni coetus fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43947.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep watch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">guard: Eu.</hi> Intus serva. <hi rend="ital">Sl.</hi> Quippini Ego intus servem? an, ne quis aedes auferat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 3 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in aedibus Servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus Sannio servat domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 627</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva!</quote> <trans><tr>take care! look out! beware!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi> an omen: secundam avem servat... servat genus altivolantum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 83 and 84 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the augurs: de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:61:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 61, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain in</hi> a place (i. e. to keep watch there); <hi rend="ital">to dwell in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabit</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te amabo, ut hanc hoc triduum solum sinas Esse hic et servare apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nidum servas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria servantem postico falle clientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae sorores, Centum quae silvas, centum quae flumina servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanem hydrum Servantem ripas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola domum et tantas servabat filia sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOMVM SERVAVIT, LANAM FECIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3848</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.14" n="C" level="2"> In late jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">servare aliquid (pecuniam) ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to get</tr>, <tr>obtain</tr>, <tr>receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:5:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 25, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:61" default="NO">26, 7, 61</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">servans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observant;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhipeus servantissimus aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 427</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
servula: <entryFree id="n43948" type="main" key="servu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">servŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>serva</etym>, <sense id="n43948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant-girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a young female servant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servulicola: <entryFree id="n43949" type="hapax" key="servu^li^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭlĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>servulus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n43949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that waits upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accommodates slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slave's drab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servulus: <entryFree id="n43950" type="main" key="servu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">servŏl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n43950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> servulum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 19</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>servus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a young slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant-lad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 58 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 62 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 8 al.</bibl>—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">homines servolos amare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
servus: <entryFree id="n43951" type="main" key="servus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>referred by the ancients to servo: <cit><quote lang="la">servi ex eo appellati sunt, quod imperatores servos vendere, ac per hoc servare, nec occidere solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; but prob. from root svar-; Lith. svaras, a weight; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/rma</foreign>; O. H. Germ. swari, burdensome; Germ. schwer, heavy; cf. also serius</etym>, <sense id="n43951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43951.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43951.2" n="A" level="2"> With homo (= 2. servus; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly ante-class.): non decet superbum esse hominem servom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43951.3" n="B" level="2"> With other subjects (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">octo milia liberorum servorumque capitum sunt capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpori, quod servum fortuna erat, vim fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciae urbes servae et vectigales (opp. liberae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:558" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o imitatores, servum pecus!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva aqua, i. e. servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servam operam, linguam liberam herus me jussit habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non serva et maxime regna hostilia ducunt (Romani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">reges serva omnia et subjecta imperio suo esse velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 46</bibl>: statu libera quicquid peperit, hoc servum heredis est, <cb n="SESC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43951.4" n="II" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., of buildings, lands, etc., <hi rend="ital">liable to certain burdens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject to a servitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera (praedia) meliore jure sunt quam serva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:34 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 2, 34 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. servio, II. B., and servitus, II B.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43952" type="main" key="servus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">serva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serving-man; a female slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maid-servant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43952.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> (syn.: famulus, mancipium), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 19</bibl> (Com. v. 5 Vahl.); Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: servi, ancillae, id. ap. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 234 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes domi etiam contumelias servorum ancillarumque pertulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus armiger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graphicus et quantivis pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam et malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestus, infidelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus a pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem servum sibi habere ad manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225</bibl></cit>: publici, <hi rend="ital">public slaves</hi>, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 100" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 100</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.—Prov.: quot servi, tot hostes, Sinn. Capito ap. Fest. s. v. quot, p. 261 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—Esp.: poenae servus, <hi rend="ital">a slave of punishment</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">condemned to servile labor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43952.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit enim eos, qui se judiciorum dominos dici volebant, harum cupiditatum esse servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam servi illi dominorum, quam tu libidinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">112: omnium libidinum servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens libertorum suorum libertus servorumque servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also the doubtful reading: legum omnes servi sumus ut liberi esse possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 146</bibl></cit> (where B. and K. have omnes servimus).—</sense><sense id="n43952.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (mostly anteclass. for ancilla): <cit><quote lang="la">servae sint istae an liberae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego serva sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum servaque natum regnum occupasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva Briseis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sesama: <entryFree id="n43953" type="main" key="se_sa^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsăma</orth>, v. sesamum.</entryFree>
sesaminus: <entryFree id="n43954" type="greek" key="se_sa^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsămĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">shsa/minos</foreign>, <sense id="n43954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of sesame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made from sesame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:168" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 47, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesamoides: <entryFree id="n43955" type="greek" key="se_sa^mo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsămŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">shsamoeide/s</foreign>, <sense id="n43955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling sesame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 64, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:52" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 21, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesamum: <entryFree id="n43956" type="greek" key="se_sa^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsămum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sīsăm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sh/samon</foreign>. <sense id="n43956.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sesame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sesamum</hi>, an oily plant, a native of the East, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:50" default="NO">11, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:56" default="NO">11, 2, 56</bibl>; 12, 15, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsĭma</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-săma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">shsa/mh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:96" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 22, § 96</bibl>, and 18, 10, 23, § 98.—* </sense><sense id="n43956.1" n="II" level="1"> Sesamum silvestre, <hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> cici, <hi rend="ital">the palma Christi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castor-oil plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sescenaris: <entryFree id="n43957" type="hapax" key="sesce_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescēnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deriv. and signif. unknown</etym>: <sense id="n43957.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">bovis sescenaris jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15, 1</bibl></cit> (but the conjectural correction to sescennalis or sexennis is improbable) Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
sesceni: <entryFree id="n43958" type="main" key="sesce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescēni</orth>, v. sescenteni.</entryFree>
sescenteni: <entryFree id="n43959" type="main" key="sescente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescentēni</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sescēni</orth> (less cor. rectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexc-</orth>), <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n43959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [sescenti], <hi rend="ital">six hundred each.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43959.1" n="A" level="2"> Form sescenteni: <cit><quote lang="la">sescenteni malleoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 610</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43959.2" n="B" level="2"> Form sesceni: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro prodidit, singula jugera vinearum sescenas urnas vini praebuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit> nummi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denaril equitibus tributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sescentesimus: <entryFree id="n43960" type="main" key="sescente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescentēsĭmus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexc-</orth>) <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n43960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">the six hundredth</hi>: anno sescentesimo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl> Mai <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno Urbis sescentesimo quinquagesimo quinto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sescenti: <entryFree id="n43961" type="main" key="sescenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ses-centi</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sex-centi</orth>; cf. Ritschl Proleg. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 114</bibl>), ae, a, <sense id="n43961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. card. adj.</hi> [sex-centum]. </sense><sense id="n43961.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">six hundred</hi>: sescenti aurei nummi Philippii. <pb n="1685" /> <cb n="SESQ" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli aetatem minus his sescentis annis fuisse cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: argenti sescentum ac mille, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curriculum longum sescentos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43961.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, like our <hi rend="ital">hundred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thousand</hi>, to signify <hi rend="ital">an immense number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an innumerable quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any amount</hi>, etc. (perh. because the Roman cohorts consisted originally of six hundred men; very freq. in prose and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sescentae ad eam rem causae possunt colligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sescentas proinde scribito jam mihi dicas: Nihil do,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad epistulas tuas, quas ego sescentas uno tempore accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sescenti sunt, qui inter sicarios accusabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sescentos cives Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 119</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sescenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">an immense number of</hi> things: <cit><quote lang="la">sescenta sunt, quae memorem, si sit otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sescenta tanta reddam, si vivo, tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 111</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sescenties: <entryFree id="n43962" type="main" key="sescenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescentĭes</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexc-</orth>), <sense id="n43962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [sescenti], <hi rend="ital">six hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sescenties HS.,</quote> <trans><tr>six hundred times a hundred thousand</tr>, <tr>sixty millions of sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16</bibl></cit> C, 14; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium sescenties,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sescenties vicies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 15</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 8</bibl>, the true read. is sescentos).</sense></entryFree>
sescentoplagus: <entryFree id="n43963" type="main" key="Sescento_pla_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sescentō-plāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sescentiplaga</etym>, <sense id="n43963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man of six hundred stripes</hi>, a name coined by Plautus: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi cottidiano sesquiopus confeceris, Sescentoplago nomen indetur tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sesculixes: <entryFree id="n43964" type="main" key="Sescu^lixes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sescŭlixes</orth>, v. Sesquiulixes.</entryFree>
sescuncia: <entryFree id="n43965" type="main" key="sescunci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescuncĭa</orth> (SESCONCIA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4563</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sesqui-uncia</etym>, <sense id="n43965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one and a half</hi> unciae, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a twelfth and a half</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">one eighth</hi> of a whole, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:59:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 50" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:60" default="NO">60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:8:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">copulae sescunciae,</quote> <trans><tr>an inch and a half thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
sescuncialis: <entryFree id="n43966" type="main" key="sescunci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescuncĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sescuncia</etym>, <sense id="n43966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a twelfth and a half</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassitudo (mensae),</quote> <trans><tr>of an inch and a half</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sescuncius: <entryFree id="n43967" type="main" key="sescunci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescuncĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sescuncia <sense id="n43967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sescuplex: <entryFree id="n43968" type="main" key="sescu^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescŭplex</orth>, <itype>plĭcis</itype>, v. sesquiplex.</entryFree>
sescuplicarius: <entryFree id="n43969" type="main" key="sescu^pli^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescŭplĭcārĭus</orth>, v. sesquiplaris <sense id="n43969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sescuplus: <entryFree id="n43970" type="main" key="sescuplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sescuplus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquiplus</orth>, in vett. edd. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 22, 20, § 84</bibl>, where, however, the best MSS. have sescuplus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sesqui</etym>, <sense id="n43970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taken once and a half</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once and a half as much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tempora tria ad duo relata sescuplum faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, Ter. Maur. Syll. pp. 2395 and 2412 P.: ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sese: <entryFree id="n43971" type="main" key="se_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēsē</orth>, v. sui.</entryFree>
seselis: <entryFree id="n43972" type="greek" key="se^se^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕsĕlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">se/selis</foreign>, <sense id="n43972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meadow saxifrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hartwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seseli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesia: <entryFree id="n43973" type="main" key="Se_sia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēsia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sessia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that presides over sowing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl> (perh. i. q. Seia).</sense></entryFree>
sesosis: <entryFree id="n43974" type="main" key="Se^so_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕsōsis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, v. Sesostris.</entryFree>
sesostris: <entryFree id="n43975" type="main" key="Se^sostris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕsostris</orth> (lengthened <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕsŏostris</orth>, Paul. Nol. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19, 21</bibl>), is, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕsō-sis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*se)swstris</foreign>, <sense id="n43975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 276</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Sesostre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Sesosidis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 11, 15, § 74</bibl> (al. Sesothis) Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Sesoside, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sesothes: <entryFree id="n43976" type="main" key="Seso_thes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sesōthes</orth>, <case>abl.</case> <itype>Sesothide</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an Egyptian king</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 9, 14, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquatus: <entryFree id="n43977" type="main" key="sesqua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sesqui</etym>, numeri, <sense id="n43977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two numbers in the ratio of three and two</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:Ped. p. 2417" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> Ped. p. 2417</bibl> P.; Aug. de Musica, 1, 10, 17.</sense></entryFree>
sesqui: <entryFree id="n43978" type="main" key="sesqui^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sesque</orth>), <sense id="n43978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [perh. contr. from semis-qui], <hi rend="ital">one half more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more by a half.</hi> As a separate word it occurs only once: <cit><quote lang="la">ut necesse sit partem pedis aut aequalem alteri parti aut altero tanto aut sesqui esse majorem (just after, sesquiplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 188</bibl></cit>. But freq. joined in one word with designations of number or quantity, with the signif. of <hi rend="ital">once and a half.</hi> Joined with numerals (octavus and tertius),<cb n="SESS" />  like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/</foreign> (in <foreign lang="greek">e)po/gdoos, e)pi/tritos</foreign>, etc.), it denotes an integer and such a fraction over as the numeral designates; v. sesquioctavus, etc.</sense></entryFree>
sesquialter: <entryFree id="n43979" type="main" key="sesqui^alter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-alter</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">once and a half</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">e)pideu/teros</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 20</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 330 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sesquiculearis: <entryFree id="n43980" type="hapax" key="sesqui^cu_le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-cūlĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a</hi> culeus <hi rend="ital">and a half</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiculus: <entryFree id="n43981" type="gloss" key="Sesqui^cu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sesquĭ-cūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (i. e. with buttocks one half too large), a surname of Strabo, Marc. Vict. p. 2456 P.</entryFree>
sesquicyathus: <entryFree id="n43982" type="main" key="sesqui^cy^a^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-cyăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> cyathus <hi rend="ital">and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquidigitalis: <entryFree id="n43983" type="hapax" key="sesqui^di^gi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-dĭgĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a digit and a half</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sesquidigitus: <entryFree id="n43984" type="main" key="sesqui^di^gi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-dĭgĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digit and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquihora: <entryFree id="n43985" type="hapax" key="sesqui^ho_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-hōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an hour and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquijugerum: <entryFree id="n43986" type="main" key="sesqui^ju_ge^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-jūgĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> juger <hi rend="ital">and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:178" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 19, 49, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquilibra: <entryFree id="n43987" type="main" key="sesqui^li_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-lībra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pound and a half</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquimensis: <entryFree id="n43988" type="hapax" key="sesqui^mensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-mensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a month and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquimodius: <entryFree id="n43989" type="main" key="sesqui^mo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-mŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peck and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:42" default="NO">1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92:section=215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92, § 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiobolus: <entryFree id="n43990" type="hapax" key="sesqui^o^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-ŏbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an</hi> obolus <hi rend="ital">and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 46, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquioctavus: <entryFree id="n43991" type="hapax" key="sesqui^octa_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-octāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos>, corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)po/gdoos</foreign>, <sense id="n43991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing nine eighths</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one and an eighth; bearing the ratio of nine to eight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. sesquitertius, and v. sesqui.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiopera: <entryFree id="n43992" type="hapax" key="sesqui^o^pe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-ŏpĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a day's work and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiopus: <entryFree id="n43993" type="hapax" key="sesqui^o^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-ŏpus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = sesquiopera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 67</bibl>.</entryFree>
sesquipedalis: <entryFree id="n43994" type="main" key="sesqui^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n43994.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a foot and a half; one foot and a half</hi> in length, breadth, or diameter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO">11, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:48" default="NO">11, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43994.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., to denote excessive length, <hi rend="ital">half a yard long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:14:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 14, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquipedaneus: <entryFree id="n43995" type="hapax" key="sesqui^pe^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-pĕdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot and a half long</hi> (more freq. sesquipedalis): <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquipes: <entryFree id="n43996" type="main" key="sesqui^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot and a half</hi> (in length, breadth, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">cytisum in sesquipedem ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam sesquipedem prohibeat infodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sesquipede est quam tu longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:60:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 60, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiplaga: <entryFree id="n43997" type="hapax" key="sesqui^pla_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-plāga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blow and a half</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stroke and a half</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sesquiplaris: <entryFree id="n43998" type="main" key="sesqui^pla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭplāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭplā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sesquiplex</etym>, <sense id="n43998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier who received a ration and a half</hi> as a reward for his bravery, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 8, n. 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3476</bibl>; called also SESQVIPLICARIVS, Hyg. Grom. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 104</bibl>, n. 245; <cit><quote lang="la">and SESCVPLICARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3408</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3416</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiplex: <entryFree id="n43999" type="main" key="sesqui^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-plex</orth>, <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n43999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taken once and a half; once and a half as much</hi>: sesquiplex aut duplex aut par, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sescuplex</orth> (cf. sescuplus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiplicarius: <entryFree id="n44000" type="main" key="sesqui^pli^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭplĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. sesquiplaris <sense id="n44000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sesquiplus: <entryFree id="n44001" type="main" key="sesqui^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sescuplus.</entryFree>
sesquitertius: <entryFree id="n44002" type="hapax" key="sesqui^terti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquĭ-tertĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos>, corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/tritos</foreign>, <sense id="n44002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing one and a third</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">four thirds; bearing the ratio of four to three</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. sesquioctavus, and v. sesqui.</sense></entryFree>
sesquiulixes: <entryFree id="n44003" type="main" key="Sesqui^u^lixes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sesquĭ-ŭlixes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sescŭlixes</orth>, Plin. H. N. praef. § 24), as the designation of a thoroughly deceitful man (qs. a Ulysses and a half), <sense id="n44003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a satire of Varro</hi> (cited very freq. by Nonius), <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45, 2</bibl>; 48, 31 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sesquunx: <entryFree id="n44004" type="main" key="sesquunx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sesquunx</orth>, <itype>uncis</itype>, v. sescuncia.</entryFree>
sessia: <entryFree id="n44005" type="main" key="Sessi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sessĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sesia.</entryFree>
sessibulum: <entryFree id="n44006" type="main" key="sessi^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n44006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chair</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 30</bibl>.—The same called <orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭbĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, p. 36" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, p. 36</bibl> Mai. <cb n="SEST" /></sense></entryFree>
sessilis: <entryFree id="n44007" type="main" key="sessi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sedeo</etym>. <sense id="n44007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be longing to sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for sitting upon</hi> (only in the poets and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tergum (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a broad foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:148" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 148</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pira minimo pe diculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44007.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwarf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus lactucae,</quote> <trans><tr>growing low</tr>, <tr>spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47, 8</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens lactuca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 48, 9</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">folium (brassicae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sessimonium: <entryFree id="n44008" type="hapax" key="sessi^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">session</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the council of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sessio: <entryFree id="n44009" type="main" key="sessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting</hi> (Ciceronian). </sense><sense id="n44009.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">status, incessus, sessio, accubitio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessiones quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44009.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sitting-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessiones gymnasiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polemonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44009.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The seat</hi> of the body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:3:50" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 3, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44009.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44009.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sitting idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loitering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tarrying</hi> in a place: <cit><quote lang="la">sessio Capitolina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigra sessio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44009.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">session</hi> (syn. consessus); <cit><quote lang="la">for discussion: pomeridiana sessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 121</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a court: dies sessionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:15:2:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 15, 2, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44009.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sittingbath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sitz - bath</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gka/qisma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:69" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sessito: <entryFree id="n44010" type="main" key="sessi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to sit much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">long</hi> (very rare): quam deam (Suadam) in Pericli labris scripsit Eupolis sessitavisse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessitandi regio,</quote> <trans><tr>of the seat</tr>, <tr>of the posteriors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 10, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sessiuncula: <entryFree id="n44011" type="hapax" key="sessi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sessio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n44011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little group</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, assembled for amusement: <cit><quote lang="la">sessiunculas consectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sessor: <entryFree id="n44012" type="main" key="sessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n44012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sits</hi> in a place, <hi rend="ital">a sitter</hi> (not ante-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n44012.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a sitter in the theatre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44012.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sitter upon a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a horseman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 34</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44012.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">one who tarries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dwells</hi> in a place, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessores veteres urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sessorium: <entryFree id="n44013" type="main" key="sesso_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44013.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n44013.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place of residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperae hujus sessorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sessus: <entryFree id="n44014" type="hapax" key="sessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sessus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ūs</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sessui impertiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sestertiarius: <entryFree id="n44015" type="main" key="sesterti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sestertĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sestertius</etym>, <sense id="n44015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worth but a sesterce;</hi> in gen., of a thing of little value: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, gladiatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 8</bibl></cit> and 11.</sense></entryFree>
sestertiolum: <entryFree id="n44016" type="hapax" key="sesterti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sestertĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id. I.</etym>, <sense id="n44016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thousand sesterces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertiolūm bis decies,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>two million sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:59:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 59, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sestertium: <entryFree id="n44017" type="main" key="sesterti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sestertĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sestertius.</entryFree>
sestertius: <entryFree id="n44018" type="main" key="sesterti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sestertĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from semis-tertius</etym>, <sense id="n44018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two and a half;</hi> only in the phrases sestertius nummus and milia sestertia; v. I. A. and I. B. 1. infra.— Mostly as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44018.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sestertĭus</orth> (written also with the characters HS.; v. B. 4. infra), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus); also in full: sestertius nummus; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sestertiūm; rarely sestertiorum or sestertiūm nummūm, <hi rend="ital">a sesterce</hi>, a small silver coin, originally equal to two and a half asses, or one fourth of a denarius. When the as was reduced in weight, during the Punic wars, the denarius was made equal to sixteen asses, and the sestertius continued to be one fourth of the denarius. Its value, up to the time of Augustus, was twopence and half a farthing sterling, or four and one tenth cents; afterwards about one eighth less. The sestertius was the ordinary coin of the Romans, by which the largest sums were reckoned. The sestertium (1000 sestertii) was equal (up to the time of Augustus, afterwards about one eighth less) to !*?8 17<hi rend="ital">s.</hi> 1<hi rend="ital">d.</hi> sterling, or $42.94 in United States coin (v. Zumpt, Gram. § 842; Dict. of Ant. s. v. as, sestertius). </sense><sense id="n44018.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertius, quod duobus semis additur (dupondius enim et semis antiquus sestertius est) et veteris consuetudinis, ut retro aere dicerent, ita ut semis tertius, quartus semis pronunciarent, ab semis tertius sestertius dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=173" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 173</bibl></cit> Müll.: nostri quartam denarii partem, quod efficie <pb n="1686" /> <cb n="SEST" /> batur ex duobus assibus et tertio semisse, sestertium nominaverunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxatio in libras sestertii singuli et in penuriā bini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl></cit>.—Freq. joined with nummus: <cit><quote lang="la">mille nongentos quinquaginta sestertios nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> sestertiūm: quid verum sit, intellego; <cit><quote lang="la">sed alias ita loquor, ut concessum est, ut hoc vel pro deum dico vel pro deorum, alias, ut necesse est, cum triumvirum non virorum, cum sestertiūm nummūm non nummorum, quod in his consuetudo varia non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertiūm sexagena milia nummūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 23, § 45</bibl>.—Rarely, sestertiorum: <cit><quote lang="la">duo milia sestertiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44018.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44018.4" n="1" level="3"> As <pos>adj.</pos> in <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>, with milia (in Varr. and Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut asinus venierit sestertiis milibus LX. (= sexaginta milibus sestertium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
