R. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex centenarius facile quadragena milia sestertia ut reddat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos numquam minus dena milia sestertia ex melle recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirrius ex aedificiis duodena milia sestertia capiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertiis octo milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:9" default="NO">3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44018.5" n="2" level="3"> To express more than two complete thousands sestertia is used as plurale tantum, with <hi rend="ital">distrib. numerals</hi> (rare before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">si qui vilicus ex eo fundo, qui sestertia dena meritasset ... domino XX. milia nummūm pro X. miserit (= decem milia sestertiūm),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidati apud eum HS. quingena deposuerunt (= quindecim milia sestertiūm),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capit ille ex suis praediis sexcena sestertia, ego centena ex meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis dena super sestertia nummum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius Hortalo se respondisse ait, daturum liberis ejus ducena sestertia singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps capiendis pecuniis posuit modum usque ad dena sestertia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">card. numerals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertia centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem donat sestertia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum sestertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:20:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex sestertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:30:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui jus esset nisi qui ... HS. CCCC. census fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44018.6" n="3" level="3"> Millions of sesterces were expressed in three ways: </sense><sense id="n44018.7" n="a" level="4"> By the words centena (or centum) milia sestertiūm, preceded by a numeral adverb (rare): miliens centena milia sestertium, <hi rend="ital">a hundred millions</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44018.8" n="b" level="4"> With ellips. of the words centena milia, the <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sestertiūm being preceded by the numeral adv. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">once in Cic.): HS. (i. e. sestertium) quater decies P. Tadio numerata Athenis ... planum faciam (i.e. sestertiūm quater decies centena milia, = 1,400,000 sesterces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 100</bibl></cit> (where B. and K. after Orell. read. ex conj., sestertium; v. Kühner, Gram. § 229, 5 b.).—</sense><sense id="n44018.9" n="c" level="4"> With sestertium, declined as <hi rend="ital">subst. neutr.</hi>, and the numeral adverbs from decies upward (also with ellips. of centena or centum milia; sestertium here = centum milia sestertiūm. The origin of this usage, which became general, has been much disputed, and it is usual to explain it, after <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 495</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>), as a grammatical blunder, by which the <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sestertium has been mistaken for a <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>, Zumpt, Gram. § 873; but it more probably grew out of the <pos>adj.</pos> use of sestertium with mille, supra; v. Fischer, Gram. 2, p. 269; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 116; Kühner, Gram. § 209). </sense><sense id="n44018.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom ei testamento sestertium milies relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne sestertium centies et octogies ... Romae in quaestu reliquisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium sexagies, quod advexerat Domitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium quadringenties aerario illatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium deciens numeratum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 70, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadringenties sestertium, quod debuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium ducenties ex eā praedā redactum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium milies in culinam congerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater milies sestertium suum vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:27:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 53</bibl>; 13, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>.—Sometimes with ellips. of sestertium: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipatio, per quam Antonius septies miliens avertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44018.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <cb n="SETA" /> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syngrapha sestertii centies per legatos facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti ad summam sestertii decies in aerarium rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertii milies servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas decies sestertii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centies sestertii largitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 58</bibl></cit>; 12, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl> (5), 2.—</sense><sense id="n44018.12" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragies sestertio villam venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexagies sestertio, tricies sestertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centies sestertio cenavit uno die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 9:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantomimae decies sestertio nubunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepto quinquagies sestertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38, 4</bibl>.—The sign HS., i.e. II. and semis, stands for sestertius, sestertia, and sestertium, in all the uses described above; when it is necessary, to avoid ambiguity, its meanings are distinguished thus: HS. XX. stands for sestertii viginti; HS. X[dibreve]X., with a line over the numeral, = sestertia vicena, or 20,000 sesterces; H[dibreve]S. X[dibreve]X., with lines over both signs, = sestertium vicies, or 2,000,000 sesterces (Kühner, Gram. § 229 Anm. 1). But in recent edd. the numerals are usu. written in full, when the meaning would otherwise be doubtful.—</sense><sense id="n44018.13" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n44018.14" n="a" level="4"> Nummo sestertio or sestertio nummo, <hi rend="ital">for a small sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a trifle</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis est, qui bona C. Rabirii Postumi nummo sestertio sibi addici velit? Tua, Postume, nummo sestertio a me addicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Matienus damnatus sestertio nummo veniit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae maxima inter vos habentur, divitiae, gratia, potentia, sestertio nummo aestiman da sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44018.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sum of money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertio amplo comparare,</quote> <trans><tr>for a large sum</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit> (40) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44018.16" n="D" level="2"> In the times of the emperors, also, <hi rend="ital">a copper coin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth four</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>; cf. Eckhel. Doctr. Num. 6, p. 283.—* </sense><sense id="n44018.17" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ses-tertĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in econom. lang., as a measure of dimension, <hi rend="ital">two and a half feet deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum agrum sat erit bipalio vertere: quod vocant rustici sestertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">siccus ager bipalio subigi debet, quae est altitudo pastinationis, cum in duos pedes et semissem convertitur humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
